ul.li1: 1Yahweh, you are my God; I will exalt you.
ul.li2: I will praise your name,
ul.li1: for you have done wonderful things,Hebrew “thing”
ul.li2: plansHebrew “plan” of old,Literally “from far away “ in faithfulness, trustworthiness.
ul.li1: 2For you have madeLiterally “placed” the city a heap,
ul.li2: the fortified city a ruin,
ul.li1: the palace of foreigners is no longerLiterally “from” a city;
ul.li2: it will neverLiterally “to eternity not” be rebuilt.
a city of ruthless nations, they will fear you.
ul.li1: 4For you have been a refuge to the poor,
ul.li2: a refuge to the needy in his distress,
a shade from the heat.
ul.li1: For the breath of the ruthless was like a rainstorm against a wall,The same consonants with different vowels can be translated “winter rainstorm”
ul.li2: 5the noise of foreigners like heat in a dry land.
ul.li1: You subdued the heat with the shade of a cloud;
ul.li2: the song of the ruthless was silenced.
ul.li1: 6And on this mountain Yahweh of hosts will make for all peoples a rich feast,Literally “feast of fat”
ul.li2: a feast of aged wines, fat filled with marrow, filtered aged wine.
ul.li1: 7And on this mountain he will destroyLiterally “engulf” the face of the shroud,
ul.li2: the shroud over all peoples,
and the woven covering over all nations.
and the Lord Yahweh will wipe off the tears from all faces,
and he will remove the disgrace of his people from all the earth,

chapter.p: 9And one will say, on that day,

ul.li1: “Look! This is our God! We have waited for him and he saved us!
ul.li2: This is Yahweh; we waited for him!
and let us rejoice in his salvation.”
ul.li1: 10For the hand of Yahweh will rest on this mountain,
ul.li2: and Moab shall be trampled down under him
ul.li3: as a heap of straw is trampled downLiterally “the trampling down of a heap of straw” in waters ofThese words are in the written Hebrew text, but not in the reading tradition (Qere) a dung heap.
ul.li1: 11And itMoab will spread out its hands in the midst of it,
ul.li2: just as the swimmer spreads out to swim,
ul.li3: and its pride will be brought low with the movementMeaning uncertain of its hands.
ul.li1: 12And he will throw down the fortification of the high point of your walls;
ul.li2: he will bring it low;
ul.li1: he will send itLiterally “cause it to touch” to the ground,
ul.li2: to the dust.
